title: What controversy surrounded The Verve's 'Bittersweet Symphony'? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you’re referring to the ‘copyright’, then it’s a somewhat long story. Basically, the verve took a sample of a cover of The Last Time by Andrew Oldham Orchestra, they got permission to use the sample from the orchestra, but not from the original artist, the rolling stones. So Allen Klein, the rolling stones’ manager, sued The Verve. They won, and Allen Klein got 100% of royalties from the song and the songwriting credits were changed to 50/50 Mick Jagger/Keith Richards. However, my personal problem with this is that ‘the last time’ isn’t really the stones song, it’s an ‘adaptation’ of ‘This may be the last time’ by the staple singers, of which they gave no credit or royalties to. In my opinion, given this the verve aren’t in the wrong at all, all on the stones and allen klein for being downright greedy and disrespectful to the original artist, The staple singers. (if this isn’t the controversy you were referring to then i’m sorry but i don’t know)
